meaningMnemonic: A <radical>leader</radical> wishing to stop <radical>criminal</radical>s will write a moving <kanji>haiku</kanji>. The leader pleads with the criminals to stop their crimes, to look within, and to realize there's more to life (like poetry!).
readingMnemonic: A <kanji>haiku</kanji> is still a <reading>hai</reading>ku (はい). Whether it's written by a law abiding leader or a criminal leader.
